org.chronos.chronograph.api.builder.graph

Interface ChronoGraphFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoGraphFinalizableBuilder<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    SELF - The dynamic type of this to return for method chaining.
    All Superinterfaces:
    org.chronos.common.builder.ChronoBuilder<SELF>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChronoGraphChunkDbBuilder, ChronoGraphInMemoryBuilder, ChronoGraphJdbcBuilder, ChronoGraphMapDbBuilder, ChronoGraphPropertyFileBuilder, ChronoGraphTuplBuilder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractChronoGraphFinalizableBuilder, ChronoGraphChunkDbBuilderImpl, ChronoGraphInMemoryBuilderImpl, ChronoGraphJdbcBuilderImpl, ChronoGraphMapDbBuilderImpl, ChronoGraphPropertyFileBuilderImpl, ChronoGraphTuplBuilderImpl

    public interface ChronoGraphFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoGraphFinalizableBuilder<?>>
extends org.chronos.common.builder.ChronoBuilder<SELF>
    A builder for instances of ChronoGraph.

    When an instance of this interface is returned by the fluent builder API, then all information required for building the database is complete, and build() can be called to finalize the build process.

    Even though the build() method becomes available at this stage, it is still possible to set properties defined by the concrete implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • withIdExistenceCheckOnAdd

        SELF withIdExistenceCheckOnAdd(boolean enableIdExistenceCheckOnAdd)
        Enables or disables the check for ID existence when adding a new graph element with a user-provided ID.

        For details, please refer to ChronoGraphConfiguration.isCheckIdExistenceOnAddEnabled().

        Parameters:
        enableIdExistenceCheckOnAdd - Use true to enable the safety check, or false to disable it.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withTransactionAutoStart

        SELF withTransactionAutoStart(boolean enableAutoStartTransactions)
        Enables or disables automatic opening of new graph transactions on-demand.

        For details, please refer to ChronoGraphConfiguration.isTransactionAutoOpenEnabled().

        Parameters:
        enableAutoStartTransactions - Set this to true if auto-start of transactions should be enabled (default), otherwise set it to false to disable this feature.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withElementCacheOfSize

        SELF withElementCacheOfSize(int cacheSize)
        Enables the Chronos cache with the given maximum number of elements.
        Parameters:
        cacheSize - The size of the cache, in elements. Must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withIndexQueryCacheOfSize

        SELF withIndexQueryCacheOfSize(int queryCacheSize)
        Enables the Chronos query cache, with the given maximum number of queries.

        It is important to note that not every graph traversal triggers an index query in the underlying ChronoDB . Only gremlin queries that require access on a secondary index will be affected, and only the response of the secondary index will be cached.

        Parameters:
        queryCacheSize - The number of index queries to cache. Must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withBlindOverwriteProtection

        SELF withBlindOverwriteProtection(boolean enableBlindOverwriteProtection)
        Enables or disables blind overwrite protection.

        If enabled, any commit that would overwrite a graph element pair written by a transaction with a higher timestamp will be rejected. In other words, if a commit has occurred on an entry, and this entry has never been visible to the current transaction, then this transaction is not allowed to "blindly overwrite" that entry.

        This setting is enabled by default and it is recommended to keep it enabled. In general, this feature will cause some overhead on the commit operation.

        Corresponds to ChronoDBConfiguration.ENABLE_BLIND_OVERWRITE_PROTECTION.

        Parameters:
        enableBlindOverwriteProtection - true to enable this feature, or false to disable it. Default is true.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • build

        ChronoGraph build()
        Builds the ChronoGraph instance, using the properties specified by the fluent API.

        This method finalizes the build process. Afterwards, the builder should be discarded.

        Returns:
        The new ChronoGraph instance. Never null.
